snippet: William C. Thompson Jr. plays up his role as steward of the city’s money while he was comptroller. But a failed $150 million investment deal using city pension funds still benefited an old friend and campaign contributor.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column asserts that William C Thompson Jr, as mayoral candidate, is playing up his role as steward of New York City's money during time he served as comptroller; notes  that a failed $150 million investment deal using city pension funds still ended up benefiting an old friend and campaign contributor.
lead_paragraph: William C. Thompson Jr. plays up his role as steward of the city’s money while he was comptroller. But a failed $150 million investment deal using city pension funds still benefited an old friend and campaign contributor.

headline.main: Plan Backed by Thompson to Invest in Northern Ireland Ended at a Cost
headline.print_headline: A Plan Backed by Thompson to Invest Funds in Northern Ireland Ended at a Cost
